Learn how to install, set up, and administer Sales Assist in your Uberflip account.

 

Before you 

  • Anyone can use Sales Assist to share Sales collections. But only users with a Sales license can create Sales collections in Sales Assist. 
  • To register your Uberflip account in Sales Assist and perform the initial setup, you must be logged in as the Primary User on your Uberflip account.
  • To perform the other actions described in this guide, you must be a member of the Account Administrators user group in Uberflip.
    • You can optionally modify which user group can perform administrative actions in Sales Assist in the app's settings.
  • If your Hub uses Front End V2, you must also install the Compatibility Pack app to use Sales Assist. If you are not sure if your Hub uses Front End V2, see this article for help.

 

About Sales Assist

What is Sales Assist?

Sales Assist is a next-generation sales engagement app for Uberflip. It's designed to help your Sales team leverage your Uberflip content for outreach, in a way that meshes seamlessly with their existing tools and workflows.

Because Sales Assist is a responsive web app, it works pretty much everywhere: users can access it on a desktop or mobile browser, as a Chrome extension, or as an Outlook add-in. As a result, Sales Assist gives your organization's Sales reps a way to access your Uberflip content wherever they happen to be working: in sales tools like Salesloft, in their emails, or on their phones.

Feature overview

Using Sales Assist, your Sales team can:

  • Quickly search your Uberflip library to find the perfect content for their needs, using smart search powered by tag groups
  • Create their own content Items for super-personalized outreach
  • Build and personalize Sales collections in seconds, using brand-compliant templates
  • Easily share Sales collections (or individual Items) with prospects by choosing from a variety of embed options, then simply copying and pasting an embed into an email
  • Automatically track how prospects are engaging with shared content, and receive real-time notifications when someone visits a shared link

What you'll learn

Follow this guide to learn how to get your organization up and running with Sales Assist, including:

  • How to install and configure the Sales Assist app in your Uberflip account
  • How to set up your Sales Assist environment, including:
    • Creating templates, preset Sales collection Banner+Logo collection styles for different use cases, verticals, etc.
    • Creating tag groups, collections of related tags to help users quickly surface relevant content
    • Building an image library for Sales reps to use on their self-created Items
  • How to onboard your users to Sales Assist
  • How to configure optional settings to tweak Sales Assist to your specific needs and preferences

Just want to get started with Sales Assist as quickly as possible? Here are the basics:

  1. Install the app: Go here to install Sales Assist in your Uberflip account.
  2. Complete the registration process:
    1. Log in to Uberflip as the Primary User and click on Sales Assist in the sidebar menu.
    2. Click on Login with Uberflip (you'll be logged in automatically).
    3. After you have logged in, select the Hub in which you want to use Sales Assist to complete the registration process.
    4. You're done!
  3. Explore the app: Now that you've set up the app, feel free to start playing around! To help you get oriented, all you need to know is that Sales Assist consists of four main areas:
    • Search: Find content Items (or create a new Item) and use it to create and share a new Sales collection.
    • collections: View previously created Sales collections to share, edit, or copy them.
    • Shares: Track how recipients are engaging with Items and Sales collections shared through Sales Assist.
    • Admin: Administer the behind-the-scenes functions of the app, which includes setting up tag groups, templates, and images to help your Sales users find content and create more attractive Sales collections.
  4. Onboard Sales users: When you're ready to to get your Sales reps into Sales Assist, simply ask them to log in, either by going to https://sa.uberflip.com in any browser, or by using the Chrome extension. Be sure to point them towards the Quick Start Guide for Sales Users to help them get started.

For in-depth instructions on how to set up and use Sales Assist, read on for the full guide.

 

Install and configure Sales Assist

In this section, we'll look at the setup process for adding Sales Assist to your Uberflip account.

Step 1: Install the Sales Assist app

To begin using Sales Assist with your Uberflip account, simply install the app from the Uberflip Marketplace by following these instructions:

How to install the Sales Assist app
  1. Log in to your Uberflip account.
  2. Go to the Sales Assist listing page in Uberflip Marketplace.
  3. Click on Install.
  4. If the app has been successfully installed, you'll see Sales Assist listed under Marketplace > Installed Apps in Uberflip.
  5. After you've successfully installed Sales Assist, you can register your Uberflip account in the app.

Step 2: Register your Uberflip account in Sales Assist

Important

This step must be completed by your Uberflip account's Primary User.

After you have installed the Sales Assist app, you need to register your Uberflip account in Sales Assist. As part of this registration process, Sales Assist will:

  • Create a Sales Assist account for your organization: This account is tied to your Uberflip account, allowing users in that account to create their own Sales Assist users.
  • Give the Sales Reps user group in your account access to the app: Sales Assist will assign the Sales Reps user group the necessary permissions to use the app (see below).
  • Allow you to choose which Hub to use with Sales Assist: The selected Hub will be the home of all Sales collections created through Sales Assist, as well as templates and Items created by users (however, if you have multiple Hubs, users will still have access to content from all Hubs when creating Sales collections).
  • Create a special Blog collection within the selected Hub: To house content Items created by Sales Assist users, the app will create a special Blog collection in your designated Hub.

Follow these instructions to register:

How to register your Uberflip account in Sales Assist
  1. Log in to Uberflip as the Primary User.
  2. In the sidebar menu, click on Sales Assist:
    • If you do not see the Sales Assist menu option in the sidebar, the app has not yet been installed: make sure to install the app first.
  3. Click on Login with Uberflip:
  4. After you successfully log in, use the dropdown to select the Hub that you want to use with Sales Assist:
    • IMPORTANT: Choose the Hub carefully, because you won't be able change your selection later! Remember that this selection does not affect which content your users will have access to, only where their Sales collections, templates, etc. will be created.
  5. Click on the Select Hub button to proceed.
  6. Sales Assist will take you to the Defaults tab in the Admin section. You'll see a message indicating that the special Sales Assist Blog collection has been created, as well as the IDs of the selected Hub and the new Sales Assist Blog collection:
  7. You're done! The registration is complete, and you can now begin using the app.

Once you've successfully installed the app and completed the registration process, you can begin to set up your Sales Assist environment. Or, skip ahead and start adding users to Sales Assist.

 

Set up and manage your Sales Assist environment

In this section, we'll look at how you can set up your Sales Assist environment to help your users get the most out of the app.

Access the Sales Assist Admin section

To set up and manage your Sales Assist environment, you'll use the app's Admin section. To access the Admin section, follow these instructions:

  1. Log in to Sales Assist as an Admin User
    • See User types below for more information on who can sign in to Sales Assist as an Admin User
  2. Click the Admin button:
  3. This will open a dropdown menu, which contains five options:
Analytics: track your team's collection share performance

See how your team's shares are performing with Sales Assist's Analytics summary dashboard.

See Sales Assist: Team stats for admins  to learn more.

Tags: create and manage tag groups

Sales Assist makes your Uberflip tags even more useful by allowing you to collect thematically related tags into tag groups. For example, you might create a Stage tag group if you tag content based on the audience's funnel stage (i.e. BOFU, MOFU, TOFU), or create tag groups for industry, buyer persona, product, etc.

With tag groups, your Sales Users don't need to know what tags you use, or spend a lot of time searching for the right ones. Instead, you can use tag groups todisplay just the tags that are relevant to your Sales team, organized by category, right in Sales Assist's Search section:

If you want to use tag groups in your Sales Assist environment, follow these instructions to learn how to create a tag group and add tags and delete tags and tag groups:

Create a tag group and add tags

  1. Log in to Sales Assist as an Admin User
  2. Click Admin > Tags
  3. Initially there is only the default tag group, Content, which is empty:
  4. To create a new tag group, simply type the name of the tag group you want to create into the Create New Tag Group box:
  5. Click on Create. The newly created tag group will appear below the default Content tag group:
  6. To add tags to a tag group, start typing the name of a tag into the search box. Sales Assist will display any tags that match your search:
  7. To add a tag to a tag group, click on it in the search results. Whenever you add a tag, it is always added to the Content tag group first:
  8. From here, simply click-and-drag the tag to the tag group you want to assign it to:
  9. Repeat this process to create more tag groups and add further tags to them. You can create as many tag groups as you need.
  10. Any tag group that contains at least one tag is displayed in the Search section of the app below the search box. The tags it contains are shown in a dropdown:
  11. Optional: Drag-and-drop tag groups to reorder them however you'd like

Delete tags and tag groups

  1. Go to Admin > Tags.
  2. To remove a tag from a tag group, just click the x beside the tag:
  3. To delete a tag group, first delete all tags from the tag group (or move them to other tag groups), then click on its delete button:
    • You can delete any empty tag group except the default Content tag group.

Info

To improve performance, Sales Assist pulls in tags from your Uberflip account and stores them in its own database. After a tag has been pulled in, Sales Assist does not check for any changes to that tag on the Uberflip side.

This means that if you rename a tag in Uberflip, this name change will not be automatically reflected in Sales Assist. Whenever you rename a tag in Uberflip, you will also need to delete this tag from your Sales Assist tag group(s), then add it again under its new name.

Templates: create and manage templates

In Sales Assist, you can create templates which your Sales Users can use to quickly build great-looking Sales collections. These templates leverage Uberflip's built-in Banner+Logo collection appearance options, so you can add banners, titles, auto-selected company and prospect logos, and even pre-selected content to create preset collection styles for a variety of use cases.

For example, you could create templates for each industry you target, such as a Manufacturing template with an industrial-themed banner and a few pieces of your best manufacturing-specific content. Then, all your Sales Users need to do is select the template as a base for their own Sales collection, add a few pieces of content and their own personalized message, and their collection is ready to go in just minutes:

How does this work?

A Sales Assist template is essentially a special Sales collection. Whenever a Sales User creates a new Sales collection in Sales Assist and selects a template, Sales Assist makes a copy of the underlying "template" Sales collection to create the new Sales collection, which applies the same appearance options and Items to the newly created collection.

If you want to use templates your Sales Assist environment, follow these instructions to learn how to create and build up a template, modify or delete a template, and set a default template:

Create and build up a template

  1. Log in to Sales Assist as an Admin User
  2. Click Admin > Templates
  3. Click on the Create New Template button:
  4. Give your new template a name, then click on Create Template:
  5. Your newly created template will be listed on the Templates tab as a private template. This means that it is currently only visible to you, and that you are able to manage the template:
  6. Click on Manage beside the template to customize its appearance and (optionally) add default Items:
  7. This will open the underlying Sales collection that powers the selected template. Click on the collection's Appearance tab to customize the template's visual elements:
  8. Sales Assist has already set the Banner+Logo appearance option for this collection, so just set the collection's appearance options as desired, i.e. the banner, text, colors, etc.
    • For instructions on how to configure these options, see this article.
  9. Optionally, you can also add default Items to the template: these Items will be "pre-filled" in any Sales collection created from this template (alongside Items added by the user who created the Sales collection). To add default items, go to the Items tab, click on Manage Items, then simply add the desired Items to the collection.
  10. When you've finished customizing the template collection, go back to Sales Assist and click on Admin > Templates to view the list of templates again.
  11. To make your new template available to Sales Users in your organization, make it public by clicking on the eye button beside it:
  12. This will move the template to the list of public templates:
  13. When you make a template public, any Sales User who creates a new Sales collection in Sales Assist will be able to select that template as an option in the Template dropdown:

Modify or delete a template

  1. Log in to Sales Assist as an Admin User and go to Admin > Templates.
  2. If the template is currently public, you must first make it private before you can modify or delete it. To do so, click on the eye button beside the template you want to manage in the list of public templates:
  3. To modify a template, click on the Manage button beside it, then make changes to the underlying Sales collection as needed.
  4. To delete a template, click on the Manage button beside it. While viewing the underlying Sales collection, click on the ... button on the right, then click on Archive collection:

Set a default template

You can set any template as the default template. This means it is automatically pre-selected in the Template dropdown when creating a new Sales collection in Sales Assist (rather than the None option).

  1. Log in to Sales Assist as an Admin User and go to Admin > Templates
  2. Find the template you want to set as the default and click on the star beside it to set it as the default:
  3. The selected template will now appear as the default choice when creating a new Sales collection in Sales Assist:
Images: create and manage an image library

When they create Items in Sales Assist, Sales Users can add an image that is displayed as a thumbnail on that Item's tile. By default, users must enter the URL where the image is hosted to add it to Sales Assist.

To make it faster and easier for your Sales Users to add images to their self-created Items (and to encourage them to use images that are consistent with your branding), you can create an image library in Sales Assist. The image library is displayed by default whenever a Sales User creates a new Item in Sales Assist, allowing them to add images with just a click:

If you want to create an image library in your Sales Assist environment, follow these instructions to learn how to add images by URL, add images from the Uberflip Image Manager, and delete images from the image library:

Add images by URL

You can add any image hosted outside Uberflip (i.e. on your own server or any other image host) to the image library using its URL:

  1. Start by copying the image's URL. The image URL must:
    • Point directly to the image: it must end with the image file extension (i.e. .png, .jpg, etc.) to be valid.
    • Be the full URL: it must include the "https://" portion.
    • Be publicly accessible: it must not require a login to access (or be otherwise restricted).
  2. Log in to Sales Assist as an Admin User
  3. Click Admin > Images
  4. Paste the image URL into the Add an Image by URL field, then click on the green checkmark button to upload the image to the Sales Assist image library:
  5. Images you've successfully added to the library will appear below the URL field:
  6. Any images you add to the library will appear in the Create Your Own Item dialog, below the Image URL field:

Add images from the Image Manager

You can also easily add images that have already been uploaded to your Uberflip account, and which appear in the Image Manager:

  1. Go to Admin > Images.
  2. Click on the magnifying glass button to the right of the Add an Image by URL field:
  3. The Image Manager will open in a new window. Using the Image Manager, find the image you want to add.
  4.  Copy the URL that appears beside the image, in the URL column:
  5. Close the Image Manager window and return to the Sales Assist Images tab.
  6. Paste the image URL into the Add an Image by URL field, then click on the green checkmark button to upload the image to the Sales Assist image library.

Delete images from the image library

  1. Go to Admin > Images.
  2. Find the image you want to delete from the library and hover your mouse over it.
  3. Click on the delete button that appears:
  4. The image will be removed from the image library immediately, and will no longer appear when creating a new Item in Sales Assist.
Settings: view and manage your Sales Assist settings

On the Settings page, you can: 

  1. Change the admin user group (see below)
  2. Manage auto archiving of unused collections and Items
  3. See the ID of the Hub where all Sales collections are created
  4. See the ID of the Blog collection where sales reps can author custom Items
  5. Add keywords for quick search (see below)

  6. Change the language used for destination pages your team creates

Change the admin user group

By default, Sales Assist administrators must be members of the Account Administrators user group in the connected Uberflip account. If you prefer to give a different user group admin access to Sales Assist instead (e.g. if your Sales Assist admins do not need to have administrator access to your Uberflip account), you can change the designated "admin user group" in Sales Assist.

Follow these instructions to change the Sales Assist admin user group:

  1. Ensure that the Uberflip account you are using belongs to both the current admin user group, AND the user group you want to switch to.
    • For example, if the current admin user group in Sales Assist is Account Administrators, and you want to switch it to Content Managers, your Uberflip account must be a member of both user groups.
  2. Log in to Sales Assist as an Admin User
  3.  Click Admin > Settings
  4. Under the Basic section, see Admin User Group  and use the dropdown to select the user group that you want to give admin access to:

    • You can select any existing user group in the connected Uberflip account, including any custom user group.
    • To prevent you from accidentally removing your own admin access, only user groups that you are a member of will be listed here (if you're logged in as the Primary User, you'll be able to see all user groups).
  5. The change will take effect immediately. Once changed, only members of the newly designated user group will be able to access Sales Assist's Admin section.
    • Previous Admin Users who are not members of the new admin user group will still be able to access Sales Assist, but will be downgraded to Sales Users (i.e. they will no longer be able to access the Admin section).

Add quick search keywords

  1. Log in to Sales Assist as an Admin User
  2.  Click Admin > Settings
  3. In the Settings tab, select Marketing collections: Quick Search
  4. In the Quick Search List field, enter your keywords
  5. Click the enter key on your keyboard after each keyword or term. Each new line while appear as a new quick search option.

That's it! All account users will now see your quick search terms on the Search page > Marketing collections tab.

Marketing collection discoverability 

In addition to the Admin section settings, you as an admin also have the ability to pin or hide Marketing collections from the search in Sales Assist, just as you would in Uberflip. 

Pin or hide Marketing collection from search in Sales Assist 
  1. In Sales Assist, go to the Search section
  2. Select the Marketing collections tab
  3. Find the Marketing collection you want to pin or hide
  4. Hover the Marketing collection and click Configure
  5. In the modal that opens
    1. Turn the Show in search results (on by default) toggle off to hide the collection from search 
    2. Turn the Pin in app (off by default) toggle on to pin the collection in the Sales Assist search 

Onboard your users to Sales Assist

In this section, we'll look at how to add users to your Sales Assist environment.

Requirements

With the correct permissions granted, any user in your Uberflip account can use Sales Assist to share collections. And with a sales license, your reps can use Sales Assist to create new collections for prospects.

Grant access your team access with the following Uberflip system permissions and licenses:

System permissions and licenses required to use Sales Assist:

Permissions:

  • API Access: Required to access the app
  • Edit collection Appearance: Required for the user to edit the appearance of templates and Sales collections
  • All Users > List and export: Required for core app functionality
  • User Groups > List and export: Required for core app functionality
  • Current User > View: Required for core app functionality
  • Current User > License >  List and export: Required for the app to check if the user has an Uberflip for Sales license
  • Sales collections > Update Authentication: Required to enable the Passphrase Protect feature

License:

  • Sales license: Required to create Sales collections

In addition to these Uberflip system permissions, Sales Assist also has its own permissions system that is used to control access to various app features (e.g. creating Items, accessing Advanced Edit options, etc.). These Sales Assist app permissions are automatically granted to the Account Administrators and Sales Reps user groups, but must be granted manually to other users/user groups to give them access to the corresponding app functionality. See below for further details.

Info

When granting the necessary license and permissions, you can do so at either the individual user level, or at the user group level. If granted at the user group level, the license and permissions will be granted to all members of the user group automatically, including any members added in the future.

User types

Sales Assist has two user types that provide different levels of access to the app:

Admin User
Has access to all areas of the app including the Admin section.
Uberflip users who are members of the Account Administrators user group (or members of admin user group, if set to a different user group) are created as this user type.
Sales User
Has access to all areas of the app except the Admin section.
Users who are members of the Sales Reps user group (or users who are a member of any other user group and who meet the requirements) are created as this user type.

Creating users

To onboard your users to Sales Assist, simply ask them to log in to the app using their Uberflip account login credentials (the email and password they use to log in to Uberflip, or your Single Sign-On service).

Your users can log in to and use Sales Assist with any of these options:

  • By going to https://sa.uberflip.com/ in any browser (desktop or mobile)
  • By logging in to Uberflip and clicking on Sales Assist in the sidebar menu
  • By installing and opening the Sales Assist Chrome extension (available from the Chrome Web Store here)
  • By installing and opening the Sales Assist Outlook Add-in (see this article for installation instructions)

After a user logs in successfully there is no further setup needed, so your users can immediately start using Sales Assist.

Tip

To get your Sales Users up and running with Sales Assist, give them the Quick Start Guide for Sales Reps.

Info

If any user in an Uberflip account (regardless of user group) attempts to log in to Sales Assist before the Primary User has completed the registration process, they will see an error message indicating that their account could not be created.

 

Configure optional settings

In this section, we'll look at optional Sales Assist settings that you can use to adjust the app to your preferences.

Enable enriched notifications

Sales Assist will send notifications to users whenever someone visits a link that was shared through the app. By default, the app sends basic notifications, which do not identify the visitor.

If you have integrated your Hub with a supported Marketing Automation Platform (MAP; any of Oracle Eloqua, Marketo, Pardot, or HubSpot) you can configure Sales Assist to send enriched notifications that incorporate visitor information from the connected MAP. In addition, you can also configure a backup enrichment source to include additional detail in notifications for cases when the visitor is not known to your MAP.

To learn how to enable and configure enriched notifications in Sales Assist, see this article:

Sales Assist: Configure engagement notifications

Configure access to app features using permissions

Sales Assist has its own system of app permissions which are used to control access to various features within the app. By default, the Account Administrators and Sales Reps user groups are granted all permissions, which means they have access to all features in the app. You can configure these permissions to customize access within the Sales Assist app to your needs:

  • If you prefer for your Sales Users not to have access to certain features, you can simply revoke the corresponding permissions from those users. For example, if you do not want your Sales Users to be able to create their own Items, you can revoke that permission, and the option to create Items will be hidden in Sales Assist. Alternatively, you can also configure the permissions to give varying levels of access to different users or user groups, e.g. Account Executives are able create Items while BDRs are not, etc.
  • If you use a different user group than the default Sales Reps user group for your Sales Users, you'll need to grant the necessary permissions to the appropriate user group.

To learn about Sales Assist's app permissions and how to configure them, see this article:

Sales Assist: Configure permissions to control access to app features

Set up separate Sales Assist experiences for different user groups

By default, you'll set up a single Sales Assist environment for all your Sales Users. But if a one-size-fits-all approach doesn't work for your organization, you can choose to set up separate environments for different user groups within your Sales Assist account.

Sales Assist environments are completely distinct from one another: each environment can have its own unique tag groups, templates, and image library, so you can customize the experience to the specific needs of each user group. When you create a new environment you can also choose which Hub it should be linked to, so you can either create multiple separate ways to use Sales Assist within the same Hub, or even use environments to use Sales Assist with multiple Hubs.

To learn how to create separate environments in Sales Assist, see this article:

Sales Assist: Create separate environments for different user groups

What's next?

Want to learn more about Sales Assist? Check out these articles:

  • User Guide for Sales Users: Learn how to use the Sales Assist features that Sales Users can access.
  • Track your teams share engagement: See how your team's shares are performing with Sales Assist's Analytics summary dashboard
  • Frequently Asked Questions: Have questions about the app? Find answers to the most commonly asked questions here.
  • Install the Outlook Add-In: Learn how to install the Sales Assist Add-in for Outlook.

item.title: [COPY] Sales Assist: User Guide for Sales Users
item.description:
Learn how to use all of Sales Assist's features as a Sales User.

 

Before you begin

  • Just need the basics? Check out the Quick Start Guide.
  • To use Sales Assist, you'll need your Uberflip username and password. If you're not sure what they are, contact your Uberflip administrator for help.

 

About Sales Assist

What is Sales Assist?

Sales Assist is a sales engagement app for Uberflip, the platform your Marketing team uses to create and manage content. Sales Assist is specifically designed to help Sales teams to leverage that content for outreach, by making it easy to find and share content right within the tools you use every day.

You can use Sales Assist pretty much anywhere: in a browser on your desktop or phone, in Outlook (as an Add-in), or in sales tools like Salesloft or Outreach (using the Chrome extension).

With Sales Assist, you can:

  • Quickly find the perfect content for your outreach (and even create your own content for super-personalized outreach)
  • Build personalized content destinations in seconds
  • Easily share content with prospects by simply copying and pasting embeds into your emails
  • Get real-time notifications when a prospect visits content you've shared

What you'll learn

Follow this guide to learn how to use all of the tools available to you in Sales Assist, including:

  • How to access and log in to Sales Assist, including how to install the Chrome extension
  • How to navigate the app
  • How to find content using keywords, tags, and content type
  • How to share individual pieces of content
  • How to select multiple pieces of content to create and share custom destinations with your prospects, including:
    • Using templates to style your destinations
    • Protecting destinations with sensitive content by adding a passphrase
    • Managing your existing destinations to modify, share, and duplicate them to create new destinations
  • How to create your own content and templates
  • How to track how prospects are engaging with content you've shared

Note

Depending on how your Sales Assist admin has configured the app for your organization, some of the tools and functionality described in this guide may not be available to you.

 

Accessing Sales Assist

In this section, we'll look at your options for accessing Sales Assist, as well as how to log in to the app.

Options for accessing Sales Assist

Because Sales Assist is a web app, there are multiple ways to access it. Simply choose the option(s) that best fit your outreach workflow:

Browser (desktop and mobile) Chrome extension Outlook Add-in
  • Works with any browser, on any desktop or mobile device.
  • Choose this option if want to use Sales Assist on a phone or tablet, or if you prefer to use a larger version of the Sales Assist interface on your desktop.

To access Sales Assist in a browser:

  • Go to https://sa.uberflip.com/
  • Requires the Google Chrome browser.
  • Opens Sales Assist in a sidebar, next to your current Chrome tab.
  • Choose this option to use Sales Assist without having to leave the tab you're currently working in. This allows you to easily access Sales Assist while you're doing outreach by email (e.g. in Gmail), or using a web-based sales engagement tool (like Salesloft).

To access Sales Assist using the Chrome extension:

  • Go to the Chrome Web Store and download and install the Sales Assist extension.
  • Click on the Extensions (puzzle piece) button in Chrome, then click on Sales Assist by Uberflip:
  • Requires Outlook 2016 or newer, or Outlook Office 365 (Outlook on the web), or Outlook.com.
  • Opens Sales Assist in a sidebar within Outlook.
  • Choose this option to use Sales Assist without having to leave Outlook. This allows you to easily access Sales Assist while you're doing email outreach.

Finding and sharing content

In this section, we'll look at how you can find content in Sales Assist, and how you can share an individual piece of content.

Finding content

Sales Assist gives you four ways to search the Items in your organization's content library: by keyword, by tags, by content type, and by collection (Marketing Stream).

By keyword By tags By type By collection

To find content Items that match one or more keywords:

  • On the All Items tab, enter the keywords you want into the search field:
  • Sales Assist will start searching as soon as you begin typing, and will display up to 50 results containing the entered keywords.
    • Sales Assist will also try to match partial keywords. For example, the keyword "market" would bring up content that contains not just the word itself, but also "markets" and "marketing".

Note

Keywords must be at least two characters long: any single character entered into the search field will be ignored.

To find content Items by their tags:

  • On the All Items tab, use the tag group dropdowns below the search field to view the available tags:
  • Click on a tag to select it. Sales Assist will immediately start searching for content tagged with the selected tag.
  • You can select one tag per available tag group.
  • You can select multiple tags (i.e. select a tag from two or more tag groups). If you select multiple tags, Sales Assist will search for content tagged with ALL of the selected tags.

Note

Tag groups are set up by Sales Assist administrators and are specific to each organization. As a result, the tag groups (and tags) you see in Sales Assist will likely be different from what is shown here.

To find content Items based on the type of content:

  • On the All Items tab, use the content type dropdown to the right of the search field to view available content types:
  • Click on the content type that you want. Sales Assist will immediately display the top 50 pieces of content of the selected type.

Note

You might see multiple instances of the same content type, as in the screenshot shown here. This happens when your organization has multiple sources of the same general type of content — in this case, videos from YouTube, Wistia, and Vidyard.

To find content Items based on the content collection (Marketing Stream) they are in:

  • Click on the Marketing Streams tab above the search field to view preset collections of content ("Streams") that your Sales Assist administrator has made available to you:
  • By default, the results panel will display highlighted Streams:
  • You can also use the search field to search through all available Streams.
  • Hover your mouse over the Stream, then click on Items on the right to view all available content in the Stream:

You can use each of the methods of finding content on the All Items tab either by itself, or in combination with the other methods. For example, you could search for content matching certain keywords, then further filter the results by tags and/or content type.

When you search for content on the All Items tab, the results will be sorted by Most Shared by default. Use the sorting dropdown in the top right of the search results area to sort the results in other ways, i.e. by Newest (publish date, most to least recent), or by Alphabetical (title, A to Z):

Other ways to find content

  • See just Items you have created: If you have created your own Items in Sales Assist, click on the button (to the right of the tag group buttons) to view them.

See an Items details, preview, and stats

You can share an individual piece of content (an Item), or a full premade collection of content (a Marketing Stream) with your prospects directly from the search results.

Sales Assist will generate a variety of embed options for content you choose to share, and you can simply paste the embed directly into an email:

To share a single piece of content or a Marketing Stream in Sales Assist, follow these instructions:

How to share a single Item

You can share individual pieces of content directly from the Search section in Sales Assist.

  1. In the Search section, click on the All Items tab.
  2. Find the content Item you want to share, then hover your mouse over it.
  3. Click on the Share button:

  4. Under Share Item with, enter the email address of the prospect you want to share this content with, then click the green checkmark button to the right.

    • Sales Assist will not send an email to this person — this is just to help you remember who this share was created for later on.
  5. When you share a single Item, it will be shown to the recipient in the context of your organization's resource center. If the same content appears in multiple different places (Streams), you can use the In Stream dropdown to choose which of the available contexts you want to use for this content:
     
    • Your shared Item will have a breadcrumb link to the Stream you select here, and your recipient will be able to navigate to and explore other content in the Stream.
  6. Next, choose the embed option you want to use. There are four options, with previews:

Tip

When you share a link to an individual Item through Sales Assist, that link contains a unique share tracking code. Whenever someone views the Item using that link, you'll get a notification, and Sales Assist will also record this activity in the My Shares section.

    3. Just Text: Just a text link, no image.

Creating, customizing, and sharing Streams

In this section, we'll look at how you can create your own custom personalized Streams (destinations) for your prospects, as well as how to customize and share your Streams.

Creating a Stream

In addition to sharing individual pieces of content, Sales Assist also allows you to collect multiple pieces of content, and use them to create a self-contained microsite called a Stream.

Streams allow you to showcase a small collection of content that you've curated for your prospect. You can personalize a Stream with a custom headline and message, and use a template to make it look great:

To create Streams, follow these instructions:

How to create a Stream

You can create your own Streams to quickly build personalized destinations for your prospects.

Option 1: Start by selecting content

You can start creating a new Stream by first choosing the content that will be in it. This option is useful if you have some specific content in mind, or if you want to really personalize the Stream for your prospect.

  1. In the Search section, find some content you want to add to your Stream, then hover your mouse over it.
  2. Click on the Add button:
  3. This will add the content to your basket, which means it's selected to be included in your Stream. Repeat the process of adding content to your basket until you've added all the Items you want.
    • You can add up to 20 Items to a Stream in total.
    • Items that have been added to your basket will stay there, even if you change your search filters or perform a whole new search. Don't be afraid to keep searching to find the perfect content!
  4. When you're ready to proceed, click on the New Stream button.
  5. Fill out the Create a New Sales Stream form to personalize the destination for your prospect:

    • Heading (required): This is your destination's headline, shown in large text across the top.
    • Message (optional): Use this to enter a brief personalized message for your prospect. It's shown immediately below the heading.
    • Prospect (optional): Enter the email or just the domain (the part of the email after the @ symbol) of your prospect. Don't worry, nothing will be sent to them yet! Sales Assist just uses this information to find the prospect's company logo.
    • Template (optional): Select a premade template to style your destination (i.e. the banner, colors, etc.).
  6. Click on Create Stream.
  7. Your Stream will now be created, and the Manage Stream page will be shown. Here, you can customize your Stream (see below) before sharing it.

Option 2: Start without selecting content

You can also create a new Stream without first selecting content. This option is useful if your organization uses templates that "pre-fill" your Stream with selected content: in this case, just choose the appropriate template while creating the Stream, then either keep only the pre-filled content, or add/remove content as needed.

  1. In Sales Assist, click on the Streams button in the navigation menu.
  2. In the top right corner, click on the +New button.
  3. This will open the Create a New Sales Stream form. Simply complete this form as described in Option 1 above, then click on Create Stream.
  4. Your Stream will be created, and you'll be taken to the Manage Stream page. From here, you can customize your Stream (see below), for example by adding or removing Items.

Info

Once you've created at least one Stream, you'll also see an Existing button below the basket. Use this button to select an existing Stream to add the content in the basket to (rather than creating a new Stream):

Customizing a Stream

After creating a Stream, you can customize it in various ways. Sales Assist will show a live preview as you make changes so you can see how it looks. You can:

  • Change the heading, message, prospect, or template
  • Add a welcome video
  • Add Stream sections
  • Add a custom banner image
  • Add a passphrase, to protect Streams with sensitive contents
  • Add, remove, or change the order of Items in the Stream

To customize a Stream, use the Manage Stream page. This page is shown automatically whenever you create a Stream, but you can also reopen it manually at any time:

  1. In Sales Assist, click on the Streams button in the navigation menu.
  2. In the list of Streams, hover your mouse over the Stream you want to customize.
  3. Click on Edit:

  4. The Manage Stream page for the selected Stream will open.

To learn how to use the various customization options, follow the instructions below:

How to change a Stream's heading, message, or prospect logo

You can modify a Stream's heading, message, or prospect and logo at any time.

  • Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to customize. Then:

    1. To change the heading: Enter new text you want to use into the Heading field. The heading on the Stream will be updated immediately.
    2. To change the message: Enter the new text you want to use into the Message field (or remove the text). The message on the Stream will be updated immediately.
    3. To change the prospect logo: Click on the current logo to open the Set Stream Logo window. Search for the company name, then click on the option you want:

      The new logo will appear in the preview to the right, and will be updated on the Stream immediately.
      • You can also change the prospect by entering a new prospect email address (or domain) into the Prospect field. Doing this will not change the current prospect logo.
      • If you want to just remove the prospect logo altogether, click on remove logo below the preview.
How to add a welcome video

Add a welcome video that will auto-open when your prospect visits your Stream for the first time. 

  1. Go to the Streams page in Sales Assist.
  2. Hover over the Stream you want to add a welcome video to and click Edit.
  3. Under the Details tab, enter the video URL into the Welcome Video URL field.
    Note: This can be hosted on any platform that supports embeddable video. 
How to add Stream section headings

Break your Stream into organized sections by adding section headings.

  1. Go to the Streams page in Sales Assist.
  2. Hover over the Stream you want to add a heading to and click Edit.
  3. Click the Items tab.
  4. Click the meatball (three dot) menu icon, then click Add a Section Heading.
    A new section heading will appear at the top of the Items list.
  5. Hover over the section heading Item and click Edit.

  7. Drag and drop your new section heading to where you'd like it in your Stream.

How to add a calendar booking CTA

Add a calendar booking CTA to your Stream or Items, so your Stream viewers can instantly book a meeting with you. 

  1. Go to the Streams page in Sales Assist.
  2. Hover over the Stream you want to add a heading to and click Edit.
  3. Select the Items tab.

How to change a Stream's template

The template you have applied to a Stream determines its appearance. Even after you have created a Stream, you can still change the template used by the Stream at any time.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to customize.
  2. Click on More Settings.
  3. Use the Template dropdown to select a new template:
  4. The new template will be applied immediately. To see the change, click on Preview Stream.
How to add a custom banner image to a Stream

When you choose a template for your Stream, it will (typically) include a preset banner image. If you want, you can replace the template-default banner image with one of your choice.

Info

To do this, you'll need the URL where the new banner image is hosted. The URL must end with the image file extension (e.g. .jpg, .png, etc.) to work.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to customize.
  2. Click on More Settings.
  3. Enter the URL of the banner image you want to use instead into the Custom Banner Image field:
  4. The new banner will be applied immediately. To see the change, click on Preview Stream.

If you change the template of this Stream after setting a custom banner, the custom banner will be removed and replaced with the banner specified in the template.

How to add a passphrase to a Stream

If you need to ensure that only a specific audience can view the Stream, you can protect it by adding a passphrase: anyone who visits the link must enter the correct passphrase before they can view the content in the Stream.

Tip

This option is especially useful for Streams that include sensitive content, such as pricing information.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to customize.
  2. Click on More Settings.
  3. Enter the passphrase you want to use into the Passphrase Protect field:
    • The passphrase must be between 6 and 40 characters in length, and must contain at least one letter and one number.
  4. If the passphrase meets the requirements, you'll see a green checkmark beside the Passphrase Protect field, and the passphrase will be applied immediately. To see the change, click on Preview Stream:
  5. Lastly, don't forget to tell your prospect what the passphrase is!

Add an Item

Creating your own content and templates

In this section, we'll look at how you can create your own content Items and templates in Sales Assist.

Creating and managing your own Items

You can create your own content Items directly within Sales Assist. This is useful for bringing documents you've created outside of Uberflip into Sales Assist, such as slide decks, spreadsheets, etc., or other one-off documents you've created especially for certain prospects. Unlike Items from your organization's content library, Items you have created are available only to you.

Tip

This feature is great for bringing in pricing sheets — especially in combination with the passphrase protect feature.

Depending on the content you're working with, you have two options when creating your own Items: you can either embed (iframe) the content, or display a link to open the content in a new tab.

Embed the content

If the content you want to share is allowed to be embedded, you can simply enter the URL where the content is hosted (e.g. a Google Docs URL), and Sales Assist will display that content within the Item:

You can embed almost any content that is hosted on the web and which is allowed to be embedded (not all content can be displayed in an iframe):

  • URLs that end with a supported Office Document filetype extension (.doc/.docx/.ppt/.pptx/.xls/.xlsx) will be displayed using the Office Web Viewer
  • URLs ending with .pdf will be displayed using the Google PDF Viewer
  • URLs to Google Docs file (including Docs, Sheets, Slides, etc.) will be displayed using the relevant Google viewer for that file type

Note

Due to Dropbox restrictions, Sales Assist can't display content hosted on Dropbox by default. If you want to bring in content from Dropbox, your Sales Assist admin must complete additional setup steps.

Display a Link

Some content can't be embedded, such as Zoom or Gong recordings. In these cases you have the option of displaying a placeholder within your Item instead, with a button that opens the content in a new tab:

Using this option allows you to "embed" any kind of content in your Items, even if that content does not allow embedding.

To create and manage your own Items, follow these instructions:

How to create an Item

You can create your own Items, which you can share directly or add to Streams like any other Item in Sales Assist.

  3. Click on the Create an Item button.
  4. In the Create and Insert Your Own Item window, paste the URL of your content into the Embed URL field:

    • Sales Assist will attempt to get an appropriate title, description, and thumbnail image for your content from the metadata of the URL you provided. If it can find these details, it will automatically prefill the relevant fields for you.
  5. If the content can't be embedded (e.g. because the website prevents embedding of their content), check the box beside Display Link instead of iFrame:
  6. If needed, complete (or edit) the Title and Description fields.
  7. If you want to change the thumbnail image (or set one, if none was found) for your Item, either:
    • Enter the URL of the image you want to use (the URL must end in an image extension, like .jpg, .png, etc.), or
    • Click on an image in the image library created by your Sales Assist admin, to use it for your Item:
  8. Optionally, you can also add some additional text that will be displayed below the embedded content. To do so, click on Add Context for Prospect, then type your text into the field that appears.
  9. When you're ready, click on the Create button to create your new Item.
  10. You'll be returned to the My Items view in the Search section, where you'll see your new Item listed:
  11. From here, you can preview your new Item, add it to a Stream, or share it directly — just like any other content Item.

Creating your own templates

In addition to the system templates that are created by your Sales Assist admins, you can also create personal templates to style your Streams. Unlike system templates, personal templates are available only to you.

How to create and customize a personal template

You can create your own personal templates, which you can use just like system templates in Sales Assist.

Tracking share engagement

In this section, we'll look at how you can keep track of how prospects are engaging with content you've shared through Sales Assist.

Tracking engagement in real-time with notifications

Sales Assist is able to notify you in real-time whenever there is activity on a link you've shared through the app. And because links created by Sales Assist are unique to specific shares, Sales Assist can attribute activity to specific shares (and, by extension, to the prospect associated with a share). As a result, you'll know exactly when your prospects are engaging with the content you've shared, and can follow up at just the right time.

Here's how it works:

  • When you share a link to content, Sales Assist starts monitoring that content for activity
  • While the app is open, Sales Assist checks every two minutes if there has been new activity on your shares
  • If there is new activity, and that activity came from a link that's tied to a particular share, Sales Assist will send you a notification:
  • You can then simply click on the notification to see more details

Sales Assist can send you two types of notifications:

  • If you're currently working in the app, it will send you an in-app notification.
  • If the app is open, but not on the active tab, it will send you a desktop notification.

If the app is not open, you won't get a notification — but you can still catch up on historical engagement records in the app when you log in again later.

Viewing share engagement and stats

Your prospects won't always be checking out your shares while you have Sales Assist open. For activity that took place while you were logged off, or for notifications you missed, you can use the My Shares section in Sales Assist to catch up.

How to view engagement stats
  1. To access the My Shares section, click on Shares in the navigation menu:
  2. Here, in the Stats tab, you'll see your Stream's activity data from the last 90 days. This includes Items views, how many people viewed your Stream, and for how long it was viewed. You'll also see performance over time and your top performing Items.
How to view historical share engagement

You can visit the My Shares section at any time to review past engagement activity on your shares.

  1. To access the My Shares section, click on Shares in the navigation menu:
  2. Select the Events Log tab
  3. The Event Log section displays specific activity details, broken down by individual shares (prospect emails), for any of your shares that had activity in the past 90 days. By default, it will show only share activity that happened in the last 48 hours:
  4. Use the filter dropdown to view older share activity for other shares (which had at least some share activity in the past 90 days). By default, the filter dropdown lists just shares with recent activity. You can also use the search field in the filter dropdown to find shares that do not appear in this list:
  5. You can also view historical share engagement for any Stream you've created directly from the My Streams section. To do so, just click on Streams, then hover your mouse over the Stream and click on the Activity button:

Info

Although Sales Assist attributes activity to specific prospects, keep in mind that this is an assumption: since the activity came from a link that's unique to your prospect, it's most likely that this is the person who visited the link — but Sales Assist has no way of knowing for certain.
